snippet: George Entwistle stepped down Saturday amid a deepening controversy over BBC news reports on prominent public figures accused of pedophilia.
abstract: BBC director general George Entwistle resigns, bowing to wave of condemnation by critics after weeks of turmoil over broadcaster's coverage of spreading pedophile scandal; Entwistle's sudden departure is prompted by outrage over report that Newsnight, network's flagship current affairs program, wrongly implicated former Conservative Party politician in pedophile scandal.

byline.original: By JOHN F. BURNS and RAVI SOMAIYA

lead_paragraph: George Entwistle stepped down Saturday amid a deepening controversy over BBC news reports on prominent public figures accused of pedophilia.

headline.main: BBC Director Quits in Furor Over Coverage of Sexual Abuse
headline.print_headline: BBC Director Quits in Furor Over Coverage
